title: HScore for Reactive Hemophagocytic Syndrome
description: Estimates the risk of having reactive hemophagocytic syndrome (RHS) based on clinical, laboratory, and histologic findings. Uses nine variables to provide a probability score ranging from <1% to >99% for RHS diagnosis.

ranges.interpretation: Probability of reactive hemophagocytic syndrome <1%. Diagnosis very unlikely based on current clinical and laboratory findings.
Low probability of reactive hemophagocytic syndrome (1-25%). Consider alternative diagnoses and monitor clinical evolution.
Intermediate probability of reactive hemophagocytic syndrome (25-99%). Further evaluation and specialist consultation recommended.
High probability of reactive hemophagocytic syndrome >99%. Diagnosis highly likely. Immediate hematology consultation and treatment initiation recommended.

references: Fardet L, Galicier L, Lambotte O, Marzac C, Aumont C, Chahwan D, Coppo P, Hie M. Development and validation of the HScore, a score for the diagnosis of reactive hemophagocytic syndrome. Arthritis Rheumatol. 2014 Sep;66(9):2613-20.

Debaugnies F, Mahadeb B, Ferster A, Meuleman N, Rozen L, Demulder A, Corazza F. Performances of the HScore in the diagnosis of hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis: a multicenter study. J Clin Med. 2021 May 17;10(10):2143.
formula: HScore = sum of weighted points from 9 variables: immunosuppression (0-18), temperature (0-49), organomegaly (0-38), cytopenias (0-34), triglycerides (0-64), fibrinogen (0-30), ferritin (0-50), AST (0-19), hemophagocytosis (0-35)
notes: Developed from multicenter retrospective cohort of 312 patients
Validates across adult and pediatric populations
Does not replace clinical judgment or bone marrow biopsy when indicated
Should be used in conjunction with expert hematology consultation
Reactive hemophagocytic syndrome is a life-threatening condition requiring urgent treatment
Original online calculator available at http://saintantoine.aphp.fr/score/
Differential diagnosis includes sepsis and hematologic malignancies
